availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah F. Hewell Parmenter in Trigg County, Kentucky, on November 20, 1830. Father of Martha A. Parmenter, Sarah E. Parmenter, Pernecia J. Parmenter, Mary C. Parmenter, William H. Parmenter, Cornelia V. Parmenter, and Ellen M. Parmenter. Married to Narcissa Stewart Parmenter in Trigg County on December 24, 1865. Blacksmith in Trigg County in 1850. Employed James H. Jones as a blacksmith in Trigg County in 1850. Master blacksmith in Eddyville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 295A-B.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 34.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321336, p. 258.
